definition: to work for a living (esp. of woman needleworker)/life of a group of stones in Go 圍棋|围棋[wei2 qi2]

to do/to make/to produce/to write/to compose/to act as/to engage in/to hold (a party)/to be/to become/to function (in some capacity)/to serve as/to be used for/to form (a bond or relationship)/to pretend/to feign/to act a part/to put on appearance
erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]

sentences.english: On day Cui Ning went out to work in Xiantan.
sentences.chinese: 一天，崔寧到湘潭市區做活兒。

sentences.english: I'm not going to break my back working for such low wages.
sentences.chinese: 我纔不願爲這麼低的工資而拼命做活。

sentences.english: I like working in the best wood .
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡用最好的木料做活。

sentences.english: I like working in the best wood.
sentences.chinese: 我喜歡用最好的木料做活。

sentences.english: One day shortly after I had come from school, my father was outside doing yard work.
sentences.chinese: 一天，我剛從學校回到家裏，父親正在院子裏做活。

sentences.english: The pupils are now working in the field.
sentences.chinese: 學生這會兒都在田間做活兒。

sentences.english: Maybe it's creativity, or caring for others, or working outside using your hands.
sentences.chinese: 也許是創新，或照顧他人，或在戶外做活。

sentences.english: Writing is a craft, like carpentry.
sentences.chinese: 寫作是道工藝，如木匠做活。

sentences.english: Eg. I'm not going to break my back working for such low wages.
sentences.chinese: 我纔不願爲這麼低的工資而拼命做活。

sentences.english: A: You should go and see how Allan handles it.
sentences.chinese: 你實該往瞅望阿倫是怎樣做活的。

sentences.english: Taboo: Saying something unlucky or working in the field.
sentences.chinese: 學生這會兒都在田間做活兒。

sentences.english: I only work in the best wood.
sentences.chinese: 有最好的木頭我才做活。

definition: erhua variant of 做活[zuo4 huo2]
erhua variant of 幹活|干活[gan4 huo2]
to make a hard living as unskilled laborer
needlework/working for a living as a needleworker
to help with farm work/casual laborer
to go to work/to start work
